verses.kjv: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the LORD.
verses.ct: People make plans in their hearts, but the right words to speak come from the LORD.

verses.kjv: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the LORD weigheth the spirits.
verses.ct: Everything a person does seems pure to them, but the LORD examines the motives behind it all.

verses.kjv: Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
verses.ct: Hand your plans over to the LORD, and your purposes will succeed.

verses.kjv: The LORD hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
verses.ct: The LORD has made everything for its own purpose — even the wicked for the day of disaster.

verses.kjv: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
verses.ct: The LORD detests everyone who is arrogant at heart. You can be sure of this: they will not escape punishment.

verses.kjv: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.
verses.ct: Through mercy and truth, sin is atoned for, and through wholehearted dedication to the LORD, people turn away from evil.

verses.kjv: When a man’s ways please the LORD, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
verses.ct: When someone's life is pleasing to the LORD, he causes even that person's enemies to live peacefully with them.

verses.kjv: Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.
verses.ct: It's far better to have a little with righteousness than enormous income gained through injustice.

verses.kjv: A man’s heart deviseth his way: but the LORD directeth his steps.
verses.ct: A person's mind plots out their path, but the LORD determines where their steps actually go.

verses.kjv: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.
verses.ct: A king speaks with divine authority; his rulings must not be unjust.

verses.kjv: A just weight and balance are the LORD’s: all the weights of the bag are his work.
verses.ct: Honest scales and measurements belong to the LORD; every standard of weight is something he cares about.

verses.kjv: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.
verses.ct: Kings should despise wrongdoing, because a throne is secured through righteousness.

verses.kjv: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.
verses.ct: Kings take pleasure in honest speech, and they value the person who speaks truthfully.

verses.kjv: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.
verses.ct: A king's fury is like a death sentence, but a wise person knows how to calm it.

verses.kjv: In the light of the king’s countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.
verses.ct: When a king's expression is favorable, it means life; his approval is like a rain cloud in spring.

verses.kjv: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!
verses.ct: Gaining wisdom is so much better than gaining gold! Choosing understanding is more valuable than silver!

verses.kjv: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.
verses.ct: The path of those who live with integrity leads away from evil; whoever guards their way protects their own soul.

verses.kjv: Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.
verses.ct: Pride leads to destruction, and an arrogant spirit leads to a downfall.

verses.kjv: Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.
verses.ct: It's better to be humble among the poor than to share stolen goods with the arrogant.

verses.kjv: He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the LORD, happy is he.
verses.ct: Whoever handles situations wisely will prosper, and whoever trusts in the LORD will be happy.

verses.kjv: The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
verses.ct: A person with a wise heart will be recognized as insightful, and gracious speech makes teaching more effective.

verses.kjv: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.
verses.ct: Understanding is a fountain of life for those who possess it, but trying to instruct fools is a waste of time.

verses.kjv: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.
verses.ct: A wise person's heart guides their speech and adds persuasiveness to their words.

verses.kjv: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
verses.ct: Kind words are like honey — sweet to the soul and healthy for the body.

verses.kjv: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
verses.ct: There is a path that seems right to a person, but in the end it leads to death.

verses.kjv: He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.
verses.ct: A worker's appetite works in their favor, because their hunger drives them on.

verses.kjv: An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.
verses.ct: A worthless person digs up trouble, and their words are like a scorching fire.

verses.kjv: A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
verses.ct: A twisted person stirs up conflict, and a gossip drives apart the closest friends.

verses.kjv: A violent man enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.
verses.ct: A violent person lures their neighbor and leads them down a harmful path.

verses.kjv: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
verses.ct: Someone who narrows their eyes is plotting something twisted; whoever purses their lips is carrying out evil.

verses.kjv: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.
verses.ct: Gray hair is a crown of honor when it's found on someone who has lived righteously.

verses.kjv: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
verses.ct: A patient person is stronger than a warrior, and someone who controls their temper is greater than someone who captures a city.

verses.kjv: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the LORD.
verses.ct: The dice may be thrown, but every outcome is determined by the LORD.
